supporting_quotes: When Salim assumed the leadership of the OAU as its secretary-general in 1989, he brought to the role a wealth of international experience and a keen recognition for the need to transform Africa from being the playground of the superpowers to Foreword
As OAU secretary-general, Salim worked tirelessly to help our leaders lay the legal foundation that led to the institutional transformation of the OAU into the African Union (AU)
during his tenure as OAU secretary-general, he became critical of the way that the OAU principle of non-interference in the internal affairs of member states hampered continental institutions

events.description: Salim oversaw military operations by Tanzanian forces in front-line countries, including Mozambique.
supporting_quotes: Salim was also active in supporting the liberation movements while he served as Tanzania’s foreign minister, deputy prime minister and minister of defence, and eventually as prime minister between 1980 and 1989.

As minister of defence, Salim oversaw military operations by Tanzanian forces in various front-line countries, including Mozambique, where Tanzania sent its soldiers to support the government’s efforts to resist the South African regime’s destabilisation activities.

events.role: Chair of the informal Africa Group of Member States
events.description: Led the Africa Group in adopting a resolute approach to reject South Africa's credentials, interpreting it as eviction from UNGA proceedings.
supporting_quotes: In August and September 1974, when Salim chaired the informal Africa Group of Member States in the UNGA, he adopted a more resolute approach:

This time, however, African delegations were determined to see to it that a mere warning was not enough and thus we had agreed to have the rejection of the credentials to be interpreted as tantamount to the eviction of South African participation in the assembly proceedings …

events.description: Spearheaded campaigns and maintained relationships to support liberation movements, particularly in South Africa's struggle against apartheid.
supporting_quotes: Among his many contributions to South Africa’s struggle against apartheid, Salim spearheaded the campaign to reject the South African delegation’s credentials to the UNGA – a memorable instance of his ability to afford diplomatic support to the independence struggle.

events.description: Ensured open dialogue and greater coordination between liberation movements, the FLS coalition, the OAU, and the UN.
supporting_quotes: Salim’s ability to maintain such relationships was essential in supporting the liberation movements, and ensuring an open dialogue and greater coordination between the liberation movements, the FLS coalition, the OAU and the UN.

events.description: Salim Ahmed Salim viewed the UNGA's repudiation of the South African government as a significant contribution to the liberation struggle.
supporting_quotes: Salim viewed this triumph as among the most significant of his contributions, noting the global importance of the UNGA’s repudiation of the South African government and the support its decision would confer on the liberation struggle and its movements, such as the ANC and the Pan-Africanist Congress (PAC).

events.description: Ensured material and financial contributions were channeled through the OAU Liberation Committee or directly to liberation movements.
supporting_quotes: Salim remained unequivocal in his requests that all material and financial contributions be channelled through the OAU Liberation Committee or directly to the liberation movements themselves.

events.description: Facilitated a cooperation agreement between the OAU and UNHCR to protect and support refugees from South Africa, Namibia, and Zimbabwe.
supporting_quotes: Salim recalls the critical importance of a cooperation agreement between the OAU and UNHCR, signed in 1973, to protect refugees from South Africa, Namibia and Zimbabwe displaced in Tanzania and Zambia by financing their education, training, resettlement and employment opportunities.

events.description: Supported the National Liberation Movement Trust Fund, which provided education and training in front-line countries, benefiting the people of Namibia.
supporting_quotes: The UN Development Programme’s National Liberation Movement Trust Fund, developed with the support of the Netherlands government in 1973, was implemented through a cooperation agreement with the OAU. This fund supported education and training in the front-line countries in projects that focused on agriculture, food production, healthcare and vocational trades, specifically benefiting the people of Namibia.

events.description: Helped shape and drive the global narrative in support of the liberation struggle, working with a coalition of liberation fighters, international organizations, religious movements, activists, and ordinary citizens.
supporting_quotes: Salim helped to shape and drive the global narrative in support of the liberation struggle. A global coalition of liberation fighters, international organisations, religious movements, activists and ordinary citizens shifted

events.description: Salim led the UN Special Committee on Decolonization, increasing the quality and scope of its work.
supporting_quotes: Under Salim’s leadership from 1972 to 1980, the Special Committee on Decolonization increased the quality and scope

events.description: Salim played a crucial role in shaping the global narrative on decolonisation by expanding and supporting the watchdog responsibilities of the committee.
supporting_quotes: Salim also played a crucial role in shaping the global narrative on decolonisation by expanding and supporting the watchdog responsibilities of the UN Special Committee on Decolonization.

events.organization: Subcommittee of the UN Special Committee on Decolonization
events.description: Following UNGA Resolution 2873 of 1971, Salim secured greater capacity for the subcommittee responsible for investigations.
supporting_quotes: Following UNGA Resolution 2873 of 1971, Salim secured greater capacity for the subcommittee of the UN Special Committee on Decolonization that was responsible for these investigations.

events.description: Assumed a watchdog role in the UN, empowering the Special Committee on Decolonization, the UNGA, and the Security Council to take firm resolutions against continued economic links between colonial governments and Western powers.
supporting_quotes: Salim to assume a watchdog role in the UN, empowering the Special Committee on Decolonization, the UNGA and the Security Council to take firm resolutions decrying the continued economic links between colonial governments and other (mostly Western) powers.
